column1: Annular pancreas is problem present at birth (congenital defect).
Newborns may have symptoms of complete blockage of the intestine.
However, up to half of people with this condition do not have symptoms until adulthood.
Adults with an annular pancreas are at increased risk for pancreatic or biliary tract cancer.
- Obstructive jaundice - Pancreatic cancer - Pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas) - Peptic ulcer - Perforation (tearing a hole) of the intestine due to obstruction - Peritonitis
